member.summary: Configuration extensions for the RabbitMQ transport

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqConfigurationExtensions.UseRabbitMqAsOneWayClient(Rebus.Config.StandardConfigurer{Rebus.Transport.ITransport},System.String)
member.summary: Configures Rebus to use RabbitMQ to transport messages as a one-way client (i.e. will not be able to receive any messages)

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use RabbitMQ to transport messages as a one-way client (i.e. will not be able to receive any messages)

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use RabbitMQ to move messages around

member.summary: Configures Rebus to use RabbitMQ to move messages around

member.name: T:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder
member.summary: Allows for fluently configuring RabbitMQ options

member.name: F:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.DefaultDirectExchangeName
member.summary: Default name of the exchange of type DIRECT (used for point-to-point messaging)

member.name: F:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.DefaultTopicExchangeName
member.summary: Default name of the exchange of type TOPIC (used for pub-sub)

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.Declarations(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Configures which things to auto-declare and whether to bind the input queue. Please note that you must be careful when you skip e.g. binding of the input queue as it may lead to lost messages if the direct binding is not established. By default, two exchanges will be declared: one of the DIRECT type (for point-to-point messaging) and one of the TOPIC type (for pub-sub). Moreover, the endpoint's input queue will be declared, and a binding will be made from a topic of the same name as the input queue in the DIRECT exchange.

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.Prefetch(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets max number of messages to prefetch

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.ExchangeNames(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Configures which names to use for the two types of necessary exchanges

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.AddClientProperties(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Adds the given custom properties to be added to the RabbitMQ client connection when it is established

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.StrictPriorityQueue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configure input queue as a strict priority queue. This setting adds "x-max-priority" argument to the input queue parameters And sets Prefetch(1) in order to strictly prioritize messages

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.PriorityQueue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Configure input queue as a priority queue.

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.Mandatory(System.Action{System.Object,Rebus.RabbitMq.BasicReturnEventArgs})
member.summary: Configure mandatory delivery. This configuration tells the server how to react if the message cannot be routed to a queue. If this configuration is set, the server will return an unroutable message with a Return method. If this configuration is not used, the server silently drops the message

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.InputQueueOptions(System.Action{Rebus.Config.RabbitMqQueueOptionsBuilder})
member.summary: Configure input queue manually. Beaware that this will override default settings. If used in conjunction with PriorityQueue and StrictPriorityQueue options it might have unexpected results.

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.RegisterEventCallbacks(System.Action{Rebus.Config.RabbitMqCallbackOptionsBuilder})
member.summary: Register RabbitMq callback events. Events are triggered dependening on the message headers.

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqOptionsBuilder.Ssl(Rebus.RabbitMq.SslSettings)
member.summary: Sets SLL settings to use when connecting to the broker This method is intended to use only when constructing RabbitMq Transport with single node provided through string connectionString

member.name: T:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqQueueOptionsBuilder
member.summary: Allows for fluently configuring RabbitMQ input queue options

member.summary: Set auto delete

member.summary: Set the arguments of the input queue

member.name: M:Rebus.Config.RabbitMqQueueOptionsBuilder.AddArgument(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Add input queue arguments to the default settings

member.summary: Will be mapped to RabbitMq URI

member.summary: Wraps in a

member.summary: Will be mapped to RabbitMq SslOptions. Could be null

member.name: T:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders
member.summary: Contains keys for RabbitMQ headers

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.Mandatory
member.summary: The mandatory flag can be thought of as turning on fault detection mode, it will only cause RabbitMQ to notify you of failures, not success. Should the message route correctly, your publisher will not be notified.

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.MessageId
member.summary: A unique identifier such as a UUID that your application can use to identify the message

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.AppId
member.summary: Id of the application publishing messages

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.CorrelationId
member.summary: If the message is in reference to some other message or uniquely identifiable item, the correlation-id is a good way to indicate what the message is referencing

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.UserId
member.summary: A free-form string that if used, RabbitMQ will validate against the connected user and drop messages if they do not match.

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.ContentType
member.summary: Specify type of the message body using mime-types

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.ContentEncoding
member.summary: used for specifying content encoding, if your message body is encoded in some special way such as zlib, deflate or base64

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.DeliveryMode
member.summary: Non-persistent (1) or persistent (2).

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.Expiration
member.summary: An epoch or unix-timestamp value as a text string that indicates when the message should expire

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.Priority
member.summary: Property specified for the use for priority ordering in queues

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.Timestamp
member.summary: An epoch or unix-timestamp value that can be used to indicate when the message was created

member.name: F:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqHeaders.Type
member.summary: A text string your application can use to describe the message type or payload

member.name: T:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport
member.summary: Implementation of that uses RabbitMQ to send/receive messages

member.summary: Constructs the RabbitMQ transport with multiple connection endpoints. They will be tryed in random order until working one is found Credentials will be extracted from the connectionString of the first provided endpoint

member.name: M:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport.#ctor(System.String,System.String,Rebus.Logging.IRebusLoggerFactory,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs the transport with a connection to the RabbitMQ instance specified by the given connection string. Multiple connectionstrings could be provided. They should be separates with , or ;

member.summary: Stores the client properties to be haded to RabbitMQ when the connection is established

member.summary: Stores ssl options to be used when connection to RabbitMQ is established intended to use with single node Rabbitmq setup

member.summary: Sets whether the exchange should be declared

member.name: M:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport.GetSubscriberAddresses(System.String)
member.summary: Gets "subscriber addresses" as one single magic "queue address", which will be interpreted as a proper pub/sub topic when the time comes to send to it

member.name: M:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport.RegisterSubscriber(System.String,System.String)

member.name: M:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport.UnregisterSubscriber(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Unregisters the queue address as a subscriber of the given topic by removing the appropriate binding

member.name: P:Rebus.RabbitMq.RabbitMqTransport.IsCentralized
member.summary: Gets whether this transport is centralized (it always is, as RabbitMQ's bindings are used to do proper pub/sub messaging)
